chunks.text:
We are waiting for your response to Ms. Grace email below.

 

With reference to your comment about CAR insurance, please note that the unaggregated TPL is included, as stated on the 2nd page of the policy. please see email attached for your reference.

 

Kindly note that @'Sajid Moonnam' <mailto:sajid.moonnam@vindicoretail.com>  is waiting for your approval to release the NOC to obtain Police permit and Mall permit.  From receiving the NOC from mall management, our GC need up to 2 working days to obtain Police permit followed by Mall permit to do hoarding installation.

 

Look forward to your earliest approval.

 

Kindly revert for any clarifications.

 

Thanks & Regards

prathap pandiyan

From: Grace Milan <Grace.Milan@chalhoub.com> 
Sent: Monday, 30 June 2025 10:10 AM
To: Ahmad Hiskol CL <a.hiskol@ae.christianlouboutin.com>; Meda Salam <MSalam@amrc.ae>; Prathap Pandiyan <Prathap.Pandiyan@3d-consultants.com>; Pierre Cotterill <p.cotterill@ae.christianlouboutin.com>; Admin <admin@scaleuae.com>; Mark Saunders <MSaunders@amrc.ae>
Cc: 'Divya Ramdas' <divya.ramdas@vindicoretail.com>; 'Faiz Ahmed' <faiz.ahmed@vindicoretail.com>; Alexis Silva <alexis.silva@vindicoretail.com>; 'Sajid Moonnam' <sajid.moonnam@vindicoretail.com>; Nancy Azzi <Nancy.Azzi@3d-consultants.com>; Mohammed AL-AREQI <Mohammed.Al-areqi@chalhoub.com>; Ahmad Hiskol CL <a.hiskol@ae.christianlouboutin.com>; Hagop Ghazarian <Hagop.Ghazarian@chalhoub.com>
Subject: RE: The Galleria West_SU160B-Christian Louboutin | CAR & WC insurance approval - Last day of trading

 

Dear Meda,

 

I hope this message finds you well and that you had a pleasant extended weekend.

 

I am writing to propose moving forward with the planned works. We acknowledge and understand that the renewal agreement is currently under review by the Galleria legal team. However, considering the progress made and the mutual benefits anticipated from the continuation of these projects, we would like to formally express our willingness to proceed with the renovation. As it is summer time, we believe it is beneficial to carry out the works during this period.

chunks.text:
I am writing to propose moving forward with the planned works. We acknowledge and understand that the renewal agreement is currently under review by the Galleria legal team. However, considering the progress made and the mutual benefits anticipated from the continuation of these projects, we would like to formally express our willingness to proceed with the renovation. As it is summer time, we believe it is beneficial to carry out the works during this period.

 

Could you please elaborate further on the risks associated with proceeding, particularly the temporary cessation of trading and the potential implications for the landlord? We are aware that we will not be selling and paying rent simultaneously, but we do not fully understand the risk for the landlord.

 

We appreciate the concerns raised regarding the insurance policies, specifically the need for an unaggregated TPL limit. I have put our insurance department on it. Please let us know if there are any amendments or additional requirements we should address to facilitate the approval process.

 

Thank you for your cooperation and support.

 

Kind regards,

 

Grace 

 

 

GRACE MILAN

GENERAL MANAGER

REAL FZE

DUBAI

‑

UNITED ARAB EMIRATES

+971 4 816 7000

	
 

 <https://chalhoubgroup.com/> 

CHALHOUBGROUP.COM <http://www.chalhoubgroup.com/> 

‑

This email is external.

Dear Prathap and Grace

 

I hope you each enjoyed the extended weekend.

 

Further to your messages, given that there is no renewal agreement in place (the draft agreement has just been shared with legal for review), the position regarding closure has not changed. 

 

If you proceed, this will remain entirely at your own risk particularly in light of the fact that these works mean that there will be no trading throughout this period. Further, I cannot authorise this given the risks to the landlord also. 

 

Regarding your policies, please note my comments as follows:

 

CAR-

1.	The TPL limit must be unaggregated, we cannot include the cap at AED10 million/

 

EL/WC

(This is complete)

 

Kind regards 

 

Meda Salam

Paralegal

 <https://url.uk.m.mimecastprotect.com/s/wr3bC3KMDuoML7pHvu5hQFDq5?domain=uae.content.exclaimer.net>

Dear Meda, 

Greetings, 

We appreciate to receive your approval on the work insurance at the earliest.

Kindly note that the closure of the existing store is scheduled for 30.06.2025 and the demolition works to follow.

So, it is critical to get the insurance approved urgently, so to close the existing store and to start the demolition works on 30.06.2025.

Kindly revert for any clarifications.

Thanks & Regards
